page.title: 07Denbury Hill Fort.
page.content: We visited the{hill fort}early in June.We had to climb a very steep lane called{Denbury Down Lane,}the footpath from the North West no longer exists nor does the lane from{Nordon Cross. } The fort is an ancient{Celtic}settle- ment with a double ditch on three sides, to the North is a single ditch. There are two tumuli within the double ditches. The{ditches}were clearly defined and, although overgrown with hazel and holly trees, were in good condition as a defence.They were between three and four metres deep. The{tumuli}appeared undisturbed, the eastern one is more clearly visible.It has a small granite marker from the last century on top. From a distance the{hilltop appears } to be crowned with deciduous trees about twelve metres tall.Ground cover was sparse.
